BackstoryDef.title: bathhouse servant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Growing up as an impoverished child meant that [PAWN_nameDef] had to take up employment in favour of academia. [PAWN_pronoun] undertook the arduous task of cleaning bathhouse customers with a strigil — a tool that rid the client of sweat, dirt and dead skin. \n\nConsidering that most of the bathhouse clientele were minotaurs, whose bodies were covered in fur, [PAWN_nameDef]’s job was extremely tiresome.

BackstoryDef.title: peasant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lead a carefree childhood in a Hellenic tribe. [PAWN_pronoun] and the other calves of the tribe would scurry, wrestle and playfight until sundown, only to arise the following day to repeat the same routine until they each grew up.

BackstoryDef.title: oiketes
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was enslaved and treat like a possession by [PAWN_possessive] master. [PAWN_nameDef] undertook a myriad of duties throughout [PAWN_possessive] childhood, such as harvesting crops, tunnelling through clay and tailoring simple garments.

BackstoryDef.title: silver slave
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was pushed down the mines at an early age in search of silver that would “bring prosperity and luxury to all”. Ultimately, [PAWN_nameDef] never got to see such luxuries and was forcibly kept down the mines for most of [PAWN_possessive] childhood.

BackstoryDef.title: military calf
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As quickly as [PAWN_nameDef] moved from crawling to walking, [PAWN_pronoun] was enlisted to train in the military, as many minotaur calves were. [PAWN_possessive] days started at the crack of dawn and were strict, harsh and physically demanding, which gave [PAWN_nameDef] an incredible sense of self-discipline.

BackstoryDef.title: herbalist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] gathered healing herbs for a wackadoo physician, who cured minotaur far and wide of their battle wounds and ailments. [PAWN_nameDef] learned well under [PAWN_possessive] master’s counsel and became a walking encyclopaedia of local verdure.

BackstoryDef.title: young messenger
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] trotted back and forth, delivering messages from pining lovers, homesick soldiers and worried parents. \n\nNot all of these letters found their recipient intact, however, as [PAWN_nameDef] quite enjoyed prizing open envelopes and catching up on the town’s gossip, before amateurishly resealing them and praying not to be found guilty.

BackstoryDef.title: philosopher
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Under the guise of [PAWN_possessive] tutor, [PAWN_nameDef] spent much of [PAWN_possessive] time contemplating the whims and wonders of the universe. [PAWN_possessive] observations on minotaur anthropology may well be studied by others in the future.

BackstoryDef.title: hetaeros
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived [PAWN_possessive] life shrouded in mystery, travelling beside wealthy minotaur warriors as what many assumed to be their concubine. \n\nWord spread that these warriors coveted [PAWN_nameDef]’s intellectual and stimulating company on their excursions, but others theorised it was [PAWN_possessive] body that they were truly after.

BackstoryDef.title: misthios
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] secured a post as a vengeful mercenary, brandishing their fists and axe for whomever supplied the gold. The spoils of war — the ones that fell into [PAWN_nameDef]’s pocket anyway — were spent on wonderous luxuries: succulent berries; lush red wine and yards of radiant, soft silk.

BackstoryDef.title: oracle
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived an ascetic life, deeming themselves as a means to relay communications from the Gods, and nothing more. Townsfolk often sought [PAWN_possessive] services to request guidance from above in exchange for a generous handful of gold coins.

BackstoryDef.title: heavyweight
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] dominated the ring in a form of wrestling known as “Palé”. Young calves would squabble at the chance to watch [PAWN_nameDef] bulldoze [PAWN_possessive] opponents into the ground, imitating [PAWN_possessive] moves and cheering [PAWN_possessive] name. \n\nThe only thing that [PAWN_nameDef] fears, is what [PAWN_pronoun] cannot fight in the ring: fire.

BackstoryDef.title: chiliarch
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] commanded an army of over one thousand hoplites, each one willing to die at [PAWN_possessive] hand. Fleshbeasts too, kneeled in surrender under [PAWN_possessive] shadow, but [PAWN_nameDef] always had little sympathy for cowards, ensuring that they never felt the sunlight’s warmth ever again.

BackstoryDef.title: rhetorician
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the needle in the haystack of [PAWN_possessive] community, possessing gripping storytelling and social skills. While many minotaur folktales consist of little more than grunts and moos, [PAWN_nameDef]’s stories had flamboyance, they had drama, but most unusually, they even had words containing over five letters. \n\nEventually, though, [PAWN_nameDef] discovered that what made [PAWN_possessive] purse full wasn’t telling humble bar stories, but engaging in political diplomacy and persuasion.

BackstoryDef.title: bathhouse attendant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] helped run and maintain the changing rooms of a glorious bathhouse. Because of it’s grandeur, the bathhouse was favoured by influential rulers, generals and politicians alike. [PAWN_nameDef] would quip that taking orders from someone was much more humorous when [PAWN_pronoun]’d seen what they kept below their waists.

BackstoryDef.title: peasant
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] lived as a peasant in a Hellenic tribe. [PAWN_nameDef] spent [PAWN_possessive] days supporting the community as-and-when [PAWN_pronoun] was needed, taking on odd jobs in calf rearing, botany and manual labour.

BackstoryDef.title: citharode
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] played an instrument called the cithara for the entertainment of minotaur soldiers returning home after war.

BackstoryDef.title: bullish academic
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Life in the sheer, unforgiving mountain range of Padova was harsh on the young [PAWN_nameDef] — but not as harsh as it was for the slaves that erected [PAWN_possessive] family home there. \n\nBeing the calf of two highly educated bovines gave [PAWN_nameDef] some rather unusual traits for a minotaur, such as [PAWN_possessive] academic prowess and total disdain for manual labour.

BackstoryDef.title: traumatised calf
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Not much is known of [PAWN_nameDef]’s childhood, other than the fact that a scolding was sometimes the only form of interaction [PAWN_pronoun] would receive from [PAWN_possessive] parents. A life-shattering rendered [PAWN_objective] mute — the incident forever sealed between [PAWN_possessive] lips.

BackstoryDef.title: troublemaker
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] made a hobby of pulling pranks on travelling humans. [PAWN_pronoun] would throw stones and pull faces at those who didn’t fall for [PAWN_possessive] tricks, before running off to find [PAWN_possessive] next victims.

BackstoryDef.title: Astrophysicist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] yearned to uncover the secrets of the stars, and to do that, [PAWN_pronoun] had to step hoof where many minotaur refused to step: human civilisation. \n\n[PAWN_pronoun] worked in a lab with a myriad of funny-looking fleshbeasts, but [PAWN_possessive] bovine temper and sarcasm prevented that rift between the two xenos from ever closing.

BackstoryDef.title: galactic inmate
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was imprisoned for [PAWN_possessive] violent outbursts. [PAWN_pronoun] was sold on the black market for [PAWN_possessive] strength and, someday, [PAWN_possessive] meat. \n\nThe inmates on [PAWN_nameDef]'s ship were destined for a life of intergalactic slavery, but through biding [PAWN_possessive] time, [PAWN_nameDef] made sure that [PAWN_pronoun] wasn't one of them, and escaped.

BackstoryDef.title: knave
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] went from a selfless village guard to a thieving knave when [PAWN_pronoun] realised what delights visitors carried in their satchels. \n\nThose who wanted to pass through the village were subject to [PAWN_nameDef]’s “suggested” donation of “whatever-is-in-your-bag”, and frankly, many struggled to refuse in the face of a seven-foot minotaur.

BackstoryDef.title: foundling
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] entered the world prematurely and stood at half of the size of [PAWN_possessive] fellow calves, leading [PAWN_possessive] father to disown [PAWN_objective] at birth.

BackstoryDef.title: seafarer
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Orphan of war [PAWN_nameDef] was stripped of all but the clothes on [PAWN_possessive] back. [PAWN_pronoun] was captured by [PAWN_possessive] assailants, but during the lengthy sail overseas, [PAWN_pronoun] bonded with, and was doted on, by the crew. [PAWN_pronoun] gained an admiration for seafaring, war and survival.

BackstoryDef.title: botanist
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: The mystifying flora around [PAWN_nameDef] perplexed [PAWN_objective], and understanding it was undoubtedly going to be a lifelong pursuit. A pursuit that [PAWN_nameDef] welcomed with open arms. And mouth, should [PAWN_possessive] findings be edible.

BackstoryDef.title: rickshaw
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] pulled vehicles like an animal. Many of these [PAWN_nameDef]-drawn-carts carried members of nobility, who would strike [PAWN_objective] should [PAWN_pronoun] make the journey too rough.

BackstoryDef.title: scrapper
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] speaks one language with total fluency, and that language is hand-to-hand combat. [PAWN_nameDef] once lead a bloody life in the clutches of a heinous clique.

BackstoryDef.title: mullered
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: As a new day dawned, so did [PAWN_nameDef], typically hungover in the doorway of an inn. This is what [PAWN_nameDef] called a “clever tactic”: starting the day exactly where [PAWN_pronoun] aimed to end it: where the alcohol was plentiful and the minotaur were merry.

BackstoryDef.title: bullsmith
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] shaped weapons for [PAWN_possessive] fellow minotaur, no matter how destitute they may be. [PAWN_nameDef] believed in arming all those who may one day stand beside [PAWN_objective] in battle. \n\nNaturally, crafting weapons on the double required [PAWN_objective] to work until nightfall, leaving [PAWN_nameDef] with very little time, and confidence, in the means of socialisation.

BackstoryDef.title: peddler
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] traversed over land and sea, peddling [PAWN_possessive] collection of trinkets to willing buyers from all walks of life. \n\nThe dangers that came with the job didn’t frighten [PAWN_nameDef], for any interfering brigands were always willing to hand over their treasures upon persuasion from [PAWN_nameDef]’s mighty fists.

BackstoryDef.title: traitor
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Fleshbeasts will part with a pretty penny in exchange for minotaur with unusual pelts — typically for the purpose of sacrificing them as a gift to their Gods. \n\nIt’s said in legend that “it takes a minotaur to take down a minotaur” and, [PAWN_nameDef] turned that sentiment into a line of business, capturing and selling their own kin in exchange for twinkling, golden pockets.

BackstoryDef.title: athlete
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: Many minotaur cultures celebrate the spectacle of their species’ power through sport. [PAWN_nameDef] trained perilously every day for the chance to participate in these very celebrations, demonstrating [PAWN_possessive] physical abilities for spectators aplenty.

BackstoryDef.title: potter
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] scoured the earth for clay to use in [PAWN_possessive] workshop. [PAWN_pronoun] turned it into magnificent pieces of pottery that told the tales of bygone minotaur heroes.
